note.p: Hungarian writer and translator. Studied philosophy, law, and theology at Debrecen. Travelled abroad from 1864 to 1866; attended Edinburgh university and lived in London. Taught at the economics institute of Debecen from 1866; professor of sciences at Pest Calvinist college. In 1870, he suggested the scientific society should publish books and became involved in the organisation of its publishing activities. Wrote for several papers and journals.
